TEI.2.document_title: Hugh B Johnston to Stephen F Austin, 11-09-1829

barker_notes.barker_summary: Hugh B. Johnston to Austin, November 9, 1829. Danger of Indian war. Much apprehension aroused by migration of Indians from the United States. Hopes Austin can stop the movement.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 283-284

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Hugh B. Johnston to Austin, November 9, 1829. Danger of Indian war. Much apprehension aroused by migration of Indians from the United States. Hopes Austin can stop the movement.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Trinity*/location_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir We have had Some apprehensions of an *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*war hear, we heard a great talk respecting it from Some particular *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned* of the *person_mentioned*Coushatties */person_mentioned*in consequence of Which I payed them a visit in company with *person_mentioned*Capt. Orr*/person_mentioned* we held a taulk with all the principle *person_mentioned*chiefs */person_mentioned*they denyed ever hearing any thing like a casperacy against the *location_mentioned*american Collany,*/location_mentioned* also appeared to be very friendly, and above all things, to be at piece and friendly with the *person_mentioned*Americans */person_mentioned*this I believe to be the truth with the great majority of the *person_mentioned*coushatties */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Allibamas */person_mentioned*but I am fully of the oppinion that there has been a considerable talk of War among the differant *person_mentioned*tribes */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*north of this*/location_mentioned* and that the *person_mentioned*Shawenees */person_mentioned*which was hostile to the *person_mentioned*Americans */person_mentioned*in the last war was the principle adgitators, the *person_mentioned*indians */person_mentioned*States that all of the auld*person_mentioned* creek Indians*/person_mentioned* is on *location_mentioned*this side of the Mississippi*/location_mentioned* and is comeing to settle among them I have had it from good authority and I expect that you are not unapprised of the fact, that they or apart of them are now on the confines of this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and are makeing application for *location_mentioned*land in the Texas*/location_mentioned*, now Sir if these *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*which are said to be from five to eight thousand Strong with all the balance of those detached warlike *person_mentioned*tribes */person_mentioned*are allowed to settle in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, I think it not hard to predict the consequence. I think from the conversation which we had on the subject a year or two ago, your views correspond with that of my own, Now Sir I think that our hope is in you to stop this great evil, by a true reppresentation to the goverment of the inevable ill consequence which must result some day or other from suffering those *person_mentioned*hell hounds*/person_mentioned* to settle among us, if they do not proclaim immedeate war or commence hostilities they will be for ever stealling and robing whear ever they have the chance if once they feel them selves strong please to right to me by the first oppertunity and communicate you Ideas to me on the Subject ard what you think can be done, I hear that the *person_mentioned*commishernor */person_mentioned*has gone on to *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*perhaps he could put a stop to those fatile invitations by some of our great *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*to those *person_mentioned*Devils */person_mentioned*visiting *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*but you know best, I remain yours with Esteem*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Hugh B Johnston*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**date_mentioned n="11-09-1829">Nov the 9th 1829*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Los 8000 *person_mentioned*indios */person_mentioned*de qe. hable el *person_mentioned*capitán Johnston*/person_mentioned* son del*person_mentioned* tribu Moscogue*/person_mentioned* ó *person_mentioned*creek */person_mentioned*y ya han emigrado al *location_mentioned*territorio de Arkansas*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Johnston */person_mentioned*es *person_mentioned*capitán de la milicia sobre el *location_mentioned*rio Trinidad*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*[Rubric]*/p*
